basics.name: Kyson Calibuso
basics.label: Shidler Undergraduate
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.B.A. in Management Information and Accounting at the University of Hawaii's Shidler College of Business. I expect to graduate in Fall, 2025.

education.area: Management Information Systems and Accounting (expected Fall, 2025)

work.company: University of Hawaii at Manoa Campus Services
highlights: Supports marketing department by producing 3-4 designs and campaigns daily using Adobe, Microsoft, & and Google applications
Works closely with campus managers to develop memorable marketing campaigns for an audience of over 20,000 people
Capture and edit photos of marketing campaigns to publish on multiple websites as well as printed materials to distribute to our audience
Responsible for meeting deadlines and maintaining excellent communication with supervisors, customers, and marketing team to ensure a smooth production flow
Manage over 20 social media accounts while compiling monthly reports for administrative use
Required to have a keen eye on student interests and campus marketing trends, as well as global trends to maintain at least an 85% engagement level with our audience

work.company: University of Hawaii at Manoa Department of Computer Science
highlights: Assists the professor and teaching assistant team in the planning and preparation of over 16 weekly lectures and labs
Aid 270+ ICS 101 students in lectures and labs to have them fully understand the concepts taught, and apply them to the real world
Lead 16 weekly office hours to ensure students gain a better understanding of the given assignments while establishing high submission rates.

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Undergraduate students are awarded the Deanâ€™s List distinction if they: (1) earn a semester grade point average of 3.5 or higher based on 12 credits or more taken for a grade (C/NC courses do not count), and (2) do not receive grades of W, I, F, or NC for that semester.

awards.title: First place - Health Career Display
awards.summary: The 2020 HOSA International Leadership Conference: Health Career Display event is a competition that provides members with the opportunity to research a career of interest, create a display board of associated career materials, and improve their presentation skills as they communicate the career information to others.
